content:
[Muki]
Kaj pa to pomeni, da so obvezne volitve (Luksemburg,
Belgija,Bolgarija) pa ni 100% udeležba?
To pomeni, da v državi obstaja zakon, s katerim so uvedli volilno
obveznost, v katerem so lahko predvidene tudi določene globe, a
bolj v teoriji. V praksi pa se zakon ne izvršuje v tej smeri, da bi
dejansko koga sankcionirali.
Pred leti so mi to pojasnjevali za Grčijo, za primer Belgije je pa
kar fin zapis na tej povezavi (ne ga sicer jemat za edini vir,
temveč bolj v ponazoritvenem smislu: 
www.brusselstimes.co...ls-belgium

"The absentees break the law and risk a fine of 40 to 80 euros.
Repeat offenders even risk a fine of up to 200 euros. People who
consistently (four times in 15 years) refuse to vote, will be
punished with a ban on voting.

However, the sanctions are never carried out. “The presidents of
the polling stations send the lists of absent voters to the justice
of the peace. They keep them for six months and then destroy them
according to the guidelines of the state archivist,” the Federal
government department for Justice explained to Het Laatste
Nieuws.

“The lists of absent voters are therefore not submitted to the
public prosecutors’ offices. Within the Public Prosecution Service
the directive applies to prosecute only the absent presidents and
co-presidents of the voting and counting offices,” he added."

In zakaj še vedno tako visoka udeležba, čeprav neudeležba načelno
ni kaznovana? V primeru Belgije je pomemben pojem - državljanska
dolžnost.
author: alina
